question: How's she doing?
answer: She wants to lay down. I'm a little worried.

question: Well, I brung her something I know she likes.
answer: Damn, Fred, you can't give away all those.

question: Forget it. I got vegetables coming out my ears. Usually the varmints eat up half my crop, but lately I ain't so much as seen a gopher or a jack-rabbit nowheres.
answer: If that ain't the truth. And I count on them for a little bit of stew meat...Thank you, Fred.

question: We playing cards tonight?
answer: I think I'm gonna be sitting up with her.

question: I'd do the same. Well, catch you Thursday.
answer: You bet. What in the name of Jehovah...?

question: Good morning, Mr. Bassett, this is your wake-up call. Please move your fat ass.
answer: You dumb shit. You didn't cook breakfast?

question: Did it yesterday. Franks and beans.
answer: No...it was eggs. I did eggs.

question: Hell you did. Your turn. How many cows does it take to make a stampede? Is it like three or more? Is there a minimum speed?
answer: I was in one. A bolt of lightning blew up cottonwood tree. Three hundred head going hell-bent for the horizon. Wasn't so damn funny, I can tell you.

question: If there was one nearby I'd probably ask him.
answer: I keep thinking, if we were but half serious about money, we should quit being hired hands and...

question: Handymen, Earl. We're handymen.
answer: Whatever the hell we are, we should quit and go get ourselves some real employment.

question: What, and give up all this personal freedom? Goddamn jeep trail gets worse every year.
answer: Has a lot of rain. You're gonna get us hung up.

question: Do not talk to the driver. What do we have next?
answer: Uh...Digging that waterhole for Nestor.

question: Burt and Heather's place is closer. Let's do their kitchen today. Do Nestor tomorrow.
answer: Nestor's out of town tomorrow. We don't dig today. We don't get paid today. Damn it, Valentine, you never plan ahead. You never take the long view. Hell, here it is Monday and I'm already working on Wednesday. It is Monday, right?

question: Who the hell's that? That's not what's his name...the grad student?
answer: Nah, it's September. Must be the new one.

question: Listen, got a question for you. Do you know if anybody is doing any blasting or drilling or anything like that?
answer: Around here? Why would they?

question: Well, I'm supposed monitor these seismographs. You know, they measure vibrations...
answer: Yeah, vibrations in the ground.

question: No problem. Nice meeting you. Hope you get it sorted out. You know, if you wanted, we could take a look at those seismographs for her.
answer: What the hell do we know about seismographs?

question: Nothing. But it sure might be a nice way of getting to know her.
answer: Why?

question: Goddamnit, Valentine, you won't go for any gal unless she fits that damn list of yours A to Z...
answer: Well, sure.

question: ...And is dumber than my hind end. Like that Bobby Lynn Dexter...
answer: Tammy Lynn Baxter.

question: Don't matter. They're all the same
answer: Well, I'm a victim of circumstance.

question: Yeah, Nestor, we know. Don't worry about it. Catch us when you can.
answer: No, we're not too easy-going. This area is economically depressed.

question: So what if we just did it...today. Pack up. Drive straight down to Bixby. Get serious.
answer: We could. We could. But we'd have to get really serious. It's gonna cost twice as much to rent a place.

question: So? That car wash pays good, and they're always looking.
answer: Car wash?! That's got no future. If we're gonna take the plunge we oughta have a better plan than that.

question: Hey, Viola, you've got my permission.
answer: God almighty, my mama sure didn't raise me for this.

question: Well, you're the one won't work in the car wash. You're the one's gotta have a plan.
answer: Damn it, Val! Not having a plan is what keeps us doing jobs like this!

question: What keeps us doing jobs like this is you dragging your feet. I was up for going to Bixby. I was getting excited.
answer: In the past year I must've said a hundred times "We gotta get out of Perfection. We gotta better ourselves." You gonna stand there in broad daylight and tell me you think I'm the reason we're still here? You want to know how close I am to going to Bixby right now?

question: I'll call that little bluff. How close?
answer: Uh oh, it's Nancy. She wants another load of firewood.

question: Forget it, man. It's not worth it.
answer: She's got us. Now, listen, the plan is

question: We did it! We faced temptation and we did not bend!
answer: Damn straight! Now there's nothing between us and Bixby but nothing!

question: Last time we hit that goddamn pothole!
answer: So long, cactus!

question: Adios, bridge!
answer: Last time down this damn twisty road!

question: Last chance, asshole. Run, run...! Okay, here's the plan. We bust our tails in the car wash six months... well, maybe nine...and we don't spend a dime, you know? And then we go for it...down payment on a tow-truck or a back-hoe or something, right? Start a real business. We can start looking for something today, tonight!
answer: Jeez, look at that guy.

question: One job I'd never take is working around electricity.
answer: Especially when it's two hundred feet off the ground.

question: You're full of shit.
answer: He's only got one damn jacket. That's him, I'm telling you.

question: Man, oh, man. He must've really been drunk this time. Edgar! What the hell you doing? Get on down from there!
answer: Well, shit, we can't leave him up there. Real sorry to bother you, Megan, but we figured since Jim's a doctor...

question: You mean he sat up there three or four days? Just sat there till he died of thirst? Reckon he hated Perfection more than us? You suppose he wanted to kill himself?
answer: If he did, why didn't he use his damn shotgun?

question: Maybe he just couldn't pull the trigger...
answer: Oh sure, he figured it was easier to die of thirst? Come on, sombody must've chased him up there.

question: Oh, you mean somebody who ain't scared of a twelve gauge shotgun. And then what did they do? Camp out down below and just wait for him to die?
answer: Well, whatever the hell happened it's just one more goddamn good reason to haul ass out of this place.

question: You got that right.
answer: Probably up a pole starving itself to death.

question: Okay, the plan is
answer: I'll go with that plan. What are you doing? What the hell...? Hey, Old Fred! Fred! Where are you?!

question: Not here. Oh, Jesus!!
answer: What the hell is going on? I mean WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON?!!

question: Consider it stepped on. Brother, we decided to leave this place just one day too late, you know?
answer: Well, there's sure as hell nothing to stop us now. Everybody we know between here and Bixby is already dead. LOOK OUT!! Is some higher force at work, here? Are we asking too much of life?

question: Those assholes are supposed to be fixing the goddamn road! Hey! Where are you guys? People gotta use this road, you know! You on a booze break or what?!
answer: Val! Val!

question: Jesus! I don't believe this!
answer: You're hung up again.

question: I am not!
answer: You're hung up I tell you. You're gonna burn the clutch.

question: Fuck you!
answer: Hey, I don't want spend the night out here!

question: I'm dead. Let's finish in the morning.
answer: We have to go into Bixby in the morning. The concrete blocks are in.

question: The con...! Oh my God.
answer: Just keep looking at that beautiful sky.

question: What?
answer: That's the sky that's going to be over our roof every night, when we're done.

question: Ah, but consider this, if we don't finish the roof, we can looks at that sky all the time.
answer: We could always buy a new generator. Well, what's wrong with it?

question: It's...gone...!
answer: You sure this is where it was?

question: Am I sure?! It was right there. There's the cord.
answer: Well don't then! You don't want to fall in.

question: What the...?
answer: Come on. Get away from it!

question: God, what a stink!
answer: Never mind! Let's go! Let's just go into town or something! Jim, please!

question: You know, I bet it's geological or something, like natural gas, or a geyser. They stink like that. Remember in Yellowstone...?
answer: Stop it! Stop it! Somebody stop it...!

question: Pham, we don't want to be stuck on a couple of canners. They better be fast.
answer: Relax. A snake thing like that couldn't move too quick.

question: Screw you. For all you know they could fly.
answer: You want the rifle or the Smith?

question: You know, we can't possibly make Bixby by nightfall. That means we're gonna be out here, like, in the dark.
answer: Great. Thank you. Hey, doctor, anybody here? Oh, man, I hate this shit.

question: Car's gone. We just missed them, that's all.
answer: Then where's the goddamn Conway Twitty coming from?

question: Here's the plan...We don't even stop. Ride like hell. Tonight we keep right on going. We'll walk the horses.
answer: That is the plan...I mean, goddamn it! What the hell are those things? How could they bury an entire Plymouth station wagon?

question: Why would they do it?
answer: I knew it! Pham Van wouldn't know a decent horse if...!

question: Shut up! They got wind of something they don't like!
answer: Oh shit!

question: Yeah...yeah. What about the hor...?
answer: That's how they get you! They're under the goddamn ground!

question: What the hell are they?
answer: Sons of bitches!

question: Nope...just one.
answer: It's gaining on us!!

question: We can do it, we can do it! Stupid son of a bitch...knocked itself cold.
answer: Cold, my ass! It's dead! We killed the bastard!

question: Hi, guys, how're you doing? Look, can I ask you something? Did you just notice something weird? Vibrations? You know, some kind of earth tremor?
answer: Jesus Christ...think it smells like that 'cause it's dead?

question: I don't see any eyes...must be totally subterranean...and those tentacles...
answer: I think they shoot right outta its mouth, hook you, and pull you right in. Good thing we stopped it before it killed anybody else.

question: I got it! Here's the other end! Just look at what we caught here!
answer: This is one big mother!

question: So this is the guy that had your seismos working overtime?
answer: Hey, Rhonda, you ever heard of anything like this before?

question: Sure, Earl, everybody knows about them. We just didn't tell you. Come on, nobody's ever seen one of these! We're really in on something here!
answer: Pham Van don't get his mitts on this for no measly fifteen bucks!

question: You got that right!
answer: Here's the plan

question: I'd vote for outer space. No way those are local boys.
answer: Atomic testing. Or, no, bio- engineering! The government built them, a big surprise in the next war.

question: Well...haven't seen a sign for hours. Maybe it's long gone.
answer: Maybe it is. Why don't you take a little stroll and see?

question: Me, too.
answer: Same here. Darn it!

question: You okay?
answer: Yeah. But I'll tell you, if you ever wanted proof God is a man, this is it. Thanks.

question: No problem. Anytime.
answer: Well, folks, what's the plan?

question: First let's see if Stumpy's still out there.
answer: Don't he have a home to go to?

question: Yeah. One, two, three...
answer: Come on, girl, it ain't gonna give us much time...

question: GO! GO! GO! We better get everybody together.
answer: You go north, I'll go south.

question: Right.
answer: I'll bet you're sorry the college ever sent you up here.

question: We need another plan.
answer: Yo, P.V., Burt here. Come back. Pham? Anybody copy?

question: Burt, now listen. We found out what's been killing people. Over?
answer: Negative copy on that, Pham, check your frequency. I'm on forty-nine.

question: Burt, can you hear me now?
answer: Just barely, Pham. What are you all doing up on your roofs. What the hell's going on? Come back.

question: Burt! This is Val! Get out of your basement!! Take your radio! You and Heather get up on your roof! Then we'll talk, okay?!
answer: Val? What the hell you doing back already?

question: Burt, get out! Get up on your roof or someplace! We found out what's been killing people! They're under the ground!
answer: What's under the ground? We're not getting up on the roof. Earth shelter's the best. Known that since I was a kid.

question: Listen! Listen! We know what they are! They're big things under the ground! Much bigger than we thought! They're coming after you! They're coming right now!
answer: We don't see anything, Val. Now what the hell are you talking about? Over.

question: They're coming underground! They ...they can dig like a son of a bitch...Big monsters under the ground, Burt! Now get the hell out! Hurry!
answer: Jesus Chri...! Broke into the wrong goddamn rec room, didn't you, you BASTARD!

question: Forget going for help. We'll all be dead long before you get back.
answer: We're here, Val. Just tell us what you need. Come back.

question: They're tearing down the houses here! We all gotta get outta here together! Now!
answer: We're with you, Val. We'll come get everybody. Just hang on tight. Val, we're going to have to forget about the truck...

question: But...we could pull something! We could, I don't know, drag a car behind it!
answer: A car, huh? Like a big armored car? Need something bigger, tougher...our truck maybe...or, hell, that old semi trailer!

question: Its tires are flat...
answer: Doesn't matter. The cat can pull anything.

question: Well...all right! We just roll on out of here!
answer: We got a plan!

question: I'm making the run to the Cat.
answer: Like hell you are.

question: Get real. I'm faster than you.
answer: I'm best at driving the Cat.

question: Only if something happens to me. Yeah, well, you're half right.
answer: I won. I pick who does it.

question: God damn! Armored transport!
answer: Let's go you two. We're headed for the mountains.

question: In a minute.
answer: Come on, Burt, we can't hold still long. They're damn smart and getting smarter by the minute.

question: That's fine. We've got some new things to teach them.
answer: Damn it! They'll sink this rig just like a boat!

question: How much you think?
answer: I don't know... They're pretty quick...fifteen seconds? What the hell is that, anyway?

question: Cannon fuse.
answer: What do you use it for?

question: They're...they're trying to make us move!
answer: Or just knock us over. Look, use the bomb!

question: It's out last one. We can't kill them all.
answer: Use the fucking bomb!

question: So, we get back on that rock and in three days we're dead anyway.
answer: I want to live for the three days.

question: No wait! This way!
answer: What the hell are you doing?!!

question: I GOT A GODDAMN PLAN!!
answer: This better be one great plan!

question: Get ready!
answer: Light it, man! LIGHT IT!!

question: Not yet, not yet...
answer: Too far! You threw it behind them!

question: Well, it just suddenly hit me, you know? Stampede?
answer: Road's in!

question: Road's in! Now, soon as we hit Bixby we start making phone calls. We could make some real money off this whole thing, get in People magazine...
answer: People? Hell, National Geographic.

question: Sell the movie rights. We're going straight from blue-collar to white -collar.
answer: Yeah...but no ties.

question: Hi, guys. Burt loaned me his camera.
answer: Howdy, Rhonda.

question: You're really leaving, huh?
answer: You bet. You gonna be staying up here?
